label: FGWDEU
info_overview: FIBARO Walli Dimmer is a smart wall dimmer designed to control light source via Z-Wave network. It measures active power and energy consumed by the controlled load. You can install it with provided cover plate and switch button or other compatible.
info_inclusion:
1. Set the main controller into the adding mode (see the controller’s manual).
  2. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  3. If you are adding in Security S2 Authenticated, input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).
  4. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end.
  5. Adding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame:
    • Green – successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),
    • Magenta – successful (Security S2 Authenticated),
    • Red – not successful.
info_exclusion:
1. Set the main controller in remove mode (see the controller's manual).
  2. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  3. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.
  4. Successful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.
  5. The device will start calibrating the load.

        This parameter determines operating mode of the device (automatic\/manual settings).<\/p>

        Parameter size:\u00a01B<\/p>

        Default value:\u00a00<\/p>

        Available values:<\/p>

        0 \u2013 calibration procedure not performed or the device operates on manual settings<\/p>

        This parameter defines percentage power variation (compared to power consumption measured during the calibration) to be interpreted as load error\/burnt out bulb.<\/p>

        Parameter size:\u00a01B<\/p>

        Default value:\u00a00<\/p>

        Available values:<\/p>

        1-99 (1-99%, 1% step) \u2013 power variation<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 99, "options": [] }, { "id": 162, "label": "Delay of a burnt out bulb and overload detection", "description": "Time delay of a burnt out bulb and overload detection", "overview": "

        This parameter defines detection delay for the burnt out bulb (parameter 161) and overload (parameter 2).<\/p>

        This parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.<\/p>

        Parameter size:\u00a02B<\/p>

        Default value:\u00a0255<\/p>

        This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.<\/p>

        This parameter defines brightness level set after double-clicking any of the buttons. The same value is also sent to devices associated with 2nd and 3rd association group.<\/p>

        This parameter allows to set the desired load control mode. Auto-calibration sets value of this parameter to 2 (control mode recognized during auto-calibration), but the installer may force control mode using this parameter.<\/p>

        After changing parameter value, turn the load OFF and ON to change control mode.<\/p>

        0 \u2013 leading edge<\/p>

        This parameter allows to read if the load detected during calibration procedure is dimmable.<\/p>

        Parameter size:\u00a01B<\/p>

        Default value:\u00a0\u2014<\/p>

        Available values:<\/p>

        0 \u2013 load recognized as dimmable<\/p>

        1 \u2013 load recognized as non-dimmable<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": true, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 1, "options": [] }, { "id": 174, "label": "Soft-start functionality", "description": "Soft-start functionality", "overview": "

        This parameter allows to set time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.<\/p>

        Parameter size:\u00a01B<\/p>

        Default value:\u00a01<\/p>

        Available values:<\/p>

        0 \u2013 no soft-start<\/p>

        1 \u2013 short soft-start (0.1s)<\/p>

        2 \u2013 long soft-start (0.5s)<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 1, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 2, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "no soft-start" }, { "value": 1, "label": "short soft-start (0.1s)" }, { "value": 2, "label": "long soft-start (0.5s)" } ] }, { "id": 175, "label": "Auto-calibration after power on", "description": "Auto-calibration after power on", "overview": "

        This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.<\/p>

        Parameter size:\u00a01B<\/p>

        Default value:\u00a01<\/p>

        Available values:<\/p>

        0 \u2013 no auto-calibration after power on<\/p>

        2 \u2013 Auto-calibration after each power on<\/p>

        3 \u2013 Auto-calibration after each LOAD ERROR (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 176 is set to 1 also after SURGE (output overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (output overcurrent)<\/p>

        4 \u2013 Auto-calibration after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 176 is set to 1 also after SURGE (output overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (output overcurrent)<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 1, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 4, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "no auto-calibration after power on" }, { "value": 1, "label": "Auto-calibration after each power on" }, { "value": 2, "label": " Auto-calibration after each LOAD ERROR" }, { "value": 4, "label": "Auto-calibratie after each power on or LOAD ERROR " } ] }, { "id": 176, "label": "Behaviour after OVERCURRENT or SURGE", "description": "Behaviour after OVERCURRENT or SURGE", "overview": "", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 1, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 1, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": " permanently disabled" }, { "value": 1, "label": "three attempts to turn on the load" } ] }, { "id": 177, "label": "Brightness level correction flickering ", "description": "Brightness level correction for flickering loads", "overview": "

        Correction reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive loads (e.g. dimmable LEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation.<\/p>

        In countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust the time of correction for flickering loads.<\/p>

        Parameter size:\u00a02B<\/p>

        Default value:\u00a0255<\/p>

        Available values:<\/p>

        0 \u2013 automatic correction disabled<\/p>

        1-254 (1-254s, 1s step) \u2013 duration of correction<\/p>

        255 \u2013 automatic correction always enabled<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 255, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] }, { "id": 178, "label": "Method of calculating the active power", "description": "Method of calculating the active power", "overview": "

        This parameter defines how to calculate active power. It is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive.<\/p>

        Default value:\u00a00<\/p>

        Available values:<\/p>

        0 \u2013 measurement based on the standard algorithm<\/p>

        1 \u2013 approximation based on the calibration data<\/p>

        2 \u2013 approximation based on the control angle<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 2, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": " standard algorithm" }, { "value": 1, "label": "approximation \/ calibration data" }, { "value": 2, "label": "approximation \/ control angle" } ] }, { "id": 179, "label": "Approximated power at max brightness", "description": "Approximated power at the maximum brightness level", "overview": "

        Available values:<\/p>

        0-500 (0-500W, 1W step) \u2013 power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level.<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 500, "options": [] } ], "associations": [ { "id": 1, "label": "Lifeline", "max_nodes": 1, "controller": true, "description": "Lifeline", "overview": "" }, { "id": 2, "label": "2nd association group", "max_nodes": 5, "controller": false, "description": "\u201cOn\/Off\u201d is used to turn the associated devices on\/off reflecting button operation (uses Basic command class).", "overview": "" }, { "id": 3, "label": "3rd association group", "max_nodes": 5, "controller": false, "description": "\"Dimmer\u201d is used to change level of associated devices reflecting button operation (uses Switch Multilevel command class).", "overview": "" } ] }
category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: ON/OFF mode
parameters.description: ON/OFF mode
parameters.overview:
This mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Setting this parameter to 1 automatically ignores brightening/dimming time settings. Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter’s value to 2.

Parameter size: 1B

Default value: 2

Available values:

0 – ON/OFF mode disabled (dimming is possible)

1 – ON/OFF mode enabled (dimming is not possible)

2 – mode selected automatically

parameters.label: Remember device state
parameters.description: Determines how the device will react in the event of power supply failure
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines how the device will react in the event of power supply failure (e.g. power outage). 

Default value: 1 (restores the state) 

Available values: 

0 – remains switched off after restoring power 

1 – restores remembered state after restoring power

options.label: remains switched off after restoring power
restores remembered state after restoring power

parameters.label: Overload safety switch
parameters.description: Turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power
parameters.overview: This function allows to turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device can be turned back on via the button or sending a control frame.

parameters.label: LED frame – power limit
parameters.description: Determines maximum active power.
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines maximum active power. Exceeding it results in the LED frame flashing violet. Function is active only when parameter 11 is set to 8 or 9.

100-5000 (10.0-500.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

parameters.label: LED frame – colour when ON
parameters.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the device is ON.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines the LED colour when the device is ON.

When set to 8 or 9, LED frame colour will change depending on the measured power and parameter 10. Other colours are set permanently and do not depend on power consumption.

Available values:

0 – LED disabled

1 – White

2 – Red

3 – Green

4 – Blue

5 – Yellow

6 – Cyan

7 – Magenta

8 – colour changes smoothly depending on measured power

9 – colour changes in steps depending on measured power

options.label: changes smoothly
options.overview: colour changes smoothly depending on measured power

options.label: changes in steps
options.overview: colour changes in steps depending on measured power

parameters.label: LED frame – colour when OFF
parameters.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the device is OFF.
parameters.overview: Available values: 0 – LED disabled 1 – White 2 – Red 3 – Green 4 – Blue 5 – Yellow 6 – Cyan 7 – Magenta

parameters.label: LED frame – brightness
parameters.description: This parameter allows to adjust the LED frame brightness.
parameters.overview:
Available values:

0 – LED disabled

1-100 (1-100% brightness)

101 – brightness directly proportional to set level

102 – brightness inversely proportional to set level

parameters.label: Buttons orientation
parameters.description: This parameter allows reversing the operation of the buttons.
parameters.overview:
0 – default (1st button brightens, 2nd button dims)

1 – reversed (1st button dims, 2nd button brightens)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
parameters.description: determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.

1B [MSB] – Notification Type

2B – Notification Status

3B – Event/State Parameters

4B [LSB] – action:

0x00 – no action,
0xX1 – turn ON,
0xX2 – turn OFF,
0xX3 – turn ON/OFF continuously,
0x0X – no action on LED frame,
0x1X – LED frame blinks red,
0x2X – LED frame blinks green,
0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,
0x8X – disable LED frame,
0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

parameters.label: First button – scenes sent
parameters.description: determines which actions result in sending scene IDs
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).

Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.

Parameter size: 1B

Default value: 0 (no scenes)

Available values:

1 – Key pressed 1 time

2 – Key pressed 2 times

4 – Key pressed 3 times

8 – Key hold down and key released

parameters.label: Second button – scenes sent
parameters.description: determines which actions result in sending scene IDs

parameters.label: Power reports – include self-consumption
parameters.description: determines whether the power measurements should include  self-consumption
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines whether the power measurements should include power consumed by the device itself.

Parameter size: 1B

Default value: 0 (not included)

Available values:

0 – Self-consumption not included

1 – Self-consumption included

parameters.label: Power reports – on change
parameters.description: defines minimal change to be reported
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that results in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.

Parameter size: 2B

Default value: 15 (15%)

Available values:

0 – reporting on change disabled

xml.xml:
Overview

FIBARO Walli Dimmer is a smart wall dimmer designed to control light source via Z-Wave network.

It measures active power and energy consumed by the controlled load.

You can install it with provided cover plate and switch button or other compatible.


Inclusion Information

  1. Set the main controller into the adding mode (see the controller’s manual).
  2. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  3. If you are adding in Security S2 Authenticated, input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).
  4. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end.
  5. Adding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame:
    • Green – successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),
    • Magenta – successful (Security S2 Authenticated),
    • Red – not successful.

Exclusion Information

  1. Set the main controller in remove mode (see the controller's manual).
  2. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  3. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.
  4. Successful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.
  5. The device will start calibrating the load.

Wakeup Information

N/A
